item.title: Very wierd?
item.dc:creator: @X-J-K-X X-J-K-X
item.description:
@X-J-K-X wrote:

[quote=“zoltanman, post:12, topic:154012”][quote author=X-J-K-X link=topic=210274.msg1842996#msg1842996 date=1193306717]

It’s not called in a method? Nor is it on the other server, and still, it works.

Oh wow, I’ll stop helping you then. You have to call it somewhere.

So where?.. Why do you think i posted this? I have no idea. . C’mon -.-…
[/quote]

If it’s not called anywhere, then of course it won’t show the gfx.[/quote]

Yeah i understand. But… If you mean call, by like… Adding…

playerGfx(252, 1);

Into the dds special method, then yes i’ve done it. If you mean call it somewhere else, no i haven’t

item.description:

[/quote]

And its fine on that server.[/quote]

If you don’t want to use it, then that’s fine with me. No delay, no gfx.

item.title: Very wierd?
item.dc:creator: @X-J-K-X X-J-K-X
item.description:
@X-J-K-X wrote:

Ok right. This is a method that some server’s use.

public void playerGfx(int id, int delay) {
mask100var1 = id;
mask100var2 = delay;
mask100update = true;
updateRequired = true;
}

That makes the GFX, move with the player, correct?.. Now. I’ve tried that on like, 4 sources. All work. Then on mine, it doesn’t…

It does the animation, but no GFX for the special…

I used it liek.
playerGfx(252, 0);

:S…

Anyone got any ideas?[br][size=1]Posted on: October 24, 2007, 01:03:12 PM[/size][hr]Anyone? :S

Read full topic
